metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3567 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the tls_decrypt_ticket function in t1_lib.c in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zc, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0o, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1j allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted session ticket that triggers an integrity-check failure.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.7').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
